page.title: 20LOCAL GARAGE & BROOK FARM
page.content:
{THE WILMOT SERVICE STATION The garage was built in 1936. It opens at 7.00 a.m. and closes at 10.00 p.m. It is a self service station. About 500 people but petrol here every day. Most people buy their petrol in pounds' worth. Four star petrol costs about Â£2.00 per gallon, almost 45p per litre. Petrol is delivered here about nine times a month. Two service engineers service about 12 cars a day.
{BROOK FARM} Brook Farm has 34 acres of land. There are 17 dairy cows and 1 calf. Milking is done by machine. Every morning the milk is collected in a tanker and taken to the dairy. 175 litres of milk is the maximum output for one day under Common Market regulations. (EEC) Any extra milk has to be thrown away.
